articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammad Salem
articles.description: Eight Palestinians were killed and dozens wounded when Israeli forces bombarded several areas of Khan Younis and Rafah in the southern Gaza Strip, health officials said on Tuesday, as thousands of people fled their homes under fire.
articles.title: Thousands flee their homes as Israeli forces bomb southern Gaza

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Emily Rose, Matt Spetalnick
articles.description: The plan for post-war Gaza that Israel pitched to U.S. allies is to run the strip in cooperation with powerful local families. But there's a problem: in a place where Hamas still wields ruthless influence, none want to be seen talking to the enemy.
articles.title: Insight: Israel's next headache: who will run post-war Gaza?

articles.author: Anastasiia Malenko, Anita Komuves
articles.description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban urged Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy on Tuesday to consider a ceasefire to accelerate an end to the war with Russia and also said he wanted a big cooperation agreement with Kyiv.
articles.title: Hungary's Orban, in Kyiv, proposes ceasefire to speed up peace talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 27 people have died in a stampede at a religious event in India's northern state of Uttar Pradesh on Tuesday, authorities said.
articles.title: At least 27 dead in stampede at religious event in north India

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Britain's Labour Party is set to sweep to power with a record number of seats at Thursday's national election, a forecast by polling company Survation showed on Tuesday.
articles.title: Poll predicts record win for Labour Party at UK election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hurricane Beryl barreled towards Jamaica as a powerful Category 5 storm on Tuesday after making landfall on smaller islands in the Caribbean, downing power lines, bringing floods and reportedly killing two people.
articles.title: Hurricane Beryl churns towards Jamaica, bringing floods; at least two reported killed

articles.author: Aaron Ross, Jefferson Kahinju
articles.description: Riot police patrolled Kenya's capital Nairobi on Tuesday morning as young activists called for more protests following last week's deadly clashes.
articles.title: Riot police patrol Nairobi as Kenyan activists call for more protests

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Ontario judge ordered pro-Palestinian protesters to leave their two-month-old encampment at Canada's largest university by Wednesday evening, granting the University of Toronto's injunction request in a ruling Tuesday.
articles.title: Canadian court grants injunction for police to clear pro-Palestinian campus encampment

articles.author: Sybille Hamaide
articles.description: Denise Rollet says she faces no good options in France's run-off legislative vote in the coming days.
articles.title: France's moderate voters face extreme choices in run-off vote

articles.author: Alexander Tanas
articles.description: A week after the European Union launched membership talks with Moldova, the country's separatist region complained on Tuesday that central authorities had ignored its proposals to settle their long-running dispute and imposed a "banking blockade".
articles.title: Moldovan separatists complain to EU about central government
